intro: Daucus arenicola, commonly known as the sandparsnip, is a flowering plant native to arid and sandy environments. It belongs to the carrot family (Apiaceae) and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Daucus arenicola is often found in coastal dunes and rocky habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environments.
